Delhi riots case: SC notice on Umar Khalid, Sharjeel's bail plea
description: The Supreme Court has deferred a hearing on the bail pleas of Umar Khalid and Sharjeel Imam, who are accused in the 2020 Delhi riots case. Both were denied bail by the Delhi High Court, which cited the gravity of their alleged roles in the conspiracy behind the violence.

'Bowlers are scared of him': Sehwag praises Sharma's batting after Ind vs Pak
description: Virender Sehwag lauded Abhishek Sharma's explosive batting in India's Asia Cup victory against Pakistan, highlighting his aggressive intent and ability to capitalize on scoring opportunities from the very first ball. Sehwag emphasized Sharma's consistent high strike rate, which instills fear in bowlers and forces them to reconsider their strategies. Sharma's fearless approach has proven instrumental in India's success.

title: Indian man in Singapore gets four years’ jail, caning for molesting woman in mall
Jacqueline Fernandez’s plea dismissed: SC refuses to intervene in Rs 200 crore case
description: Jacqueline Fernandez faces a setback as the Supreme Court declines to interfere with the money laundering case involving alleged conman Sukesh Chandrasekhar. The court upheld the Delhi High Court's decision to dismiss Fernandez's plea to quash the Enforcement Directorate's proceedings. Fernandez maintains her innocence, claiming false implication in the Rs 200 crore case.

Gold rate today: Prices hit fresh lifetime highs of Rs 1.11 lakh/10 grams
description: Gold rate today: Gold prices soared to record highs in domestic futures trading, reaching Rs 1.11 lakh per 10 grams, mirroring global trends as investors await US inflation data and Federal Reserve statements. Silver futures also surged, driven by investment flows and industrial demand, with analysts forecasting further price increases. A weaker rupee and geopolitical tensions further supported bullion's rise.

Delhi Ramleela committee signs Poonam Pandey; BJP, VHP seek replacement
description: The Luv Kush Ramleela Committee's decision to cast Poonam Pandey as Mandodari in their upcoming Ramleela performance has sparked controversy, drawing criticism from the BJP and VHP. These groups are demanding her replacement due to her past controversies and social media presence. While the committee remains open to discussions, they defend their choice, emphasizing that everyone deserves a chance.

Usain Bolt to light up football pitch in Mumbai on October 1; fans ecstatic
description: Usain Bolt, the eight-time Olympic gold medalist, world record holder, and global sporting icon will trade his running spikes for football boots in a one-of-a-kind spectacle in Mumbai on October 1. Taking centre stage, the fastest man on earth will light up the pitch in an exclusive football showcase alongside top teams and players, as per a release from PUMA.

‘Forced to pay Rs 10,000 bar bill’: Hyderabad student dies by suicide, uploads video
description: A 19-year-old engineering student in Hyderabad tragically died by suicide, alleging extortion by friends. He claimed they forced him to pay a Rs 10,000 bar bill after a party in Medipally. Police have registered a case of abetment to suicide, extortion, and violation of the SC&ST Act against the suspects, who are currently being sought.

description: In Kollam, a tragic incident unfolded as Shalini was allegedly murdered by her husband, Isaac, at their Koothanadi residence near Punalur. Following the gruesome act, Isaac confessed to the crime via a Facebook Live video, citing distrust and accusations of jewellery misappropriation.

India vs Pak: 'Won the battle' - Haris Rauf's wife adds to off-field drama
description: Even as India continued their unbeaten run against Pakistan in the Asia Cup, off-field drama has grabbed headlines. Haris Rauf, who made a jets crashing gesture coupled with a 6-0 sign, has found support from his wife who posted about it on social media. On the field, India had an easy time of beating Pakistan and keeping themselves unbeaten in the tournament.

title: ‘Will you give up the foreign jet you roam around in?’ Kejriwal on PM’s 'swadeshi' push
description: Arvind Kejriwal criticized Prime Minister Narendra Modi's call for Swadeshi, questioning Modi's own use of foreign goods, including his airplane. AAP MP Sanjay Singh accused Modi of hypocrisy, citing his reliance on international brands while advocating for indigenous products. These remarks followed Modi's address urging citizens to prioritize Made in India products and promote Swadeshi in every home and shop.

description: The Supreme Court has expressed serious concerns regarding the AAIB preliminary report on the Air India crash, deeming some aspects "irresponsible." Notices were issued to the Centre and DGCA following a plea for an independent probe, highlighting potential conflict-of-interest concerns due to the probe panel's composition and allegations of withheld critical information, including flight data.

Her husband, Siraz Khan, 70, was found in critical condition and rushed to AIIMS. Their son, Imran, who has a history of psychiatric illness, was present but unresponsive.

Kaneria lauded the Indian openers' aggressive counterattack, which left Pakistan's bowlers clueless. He also dismissed Fakhar Zaman's potential complaints about his dismissal, asserting it was a clean catch.

description: Indian companies are reducing prices, exceeding GST cuts, to boost consumer demand during the festival season. Businesses across various sectors, from food to footwear, are implementing new price tags and informing distributors. While some sectors express concerns, most anticipate increased sales volumes due to lower prices, with industry bodies ensuring the benefits reach consumers.

description: Effective September 22, 2025, the Modi government's GST 2.0 simplifies taxation with two slabs (5% and 18%), benefiting households, businesses, and farmers. Essentials become cheaper, life insurance is GST-free, and healthcare costs decrease. Consumer durables, housing materials, and auto sectors also see reduced GST, boosting affordability and domestic manufacturing.

Akanksha, who befriended Suraj on Instagram, was reportedly strangled after a dispute. Suraj confessed, revealing he and Ashish disposed of the body in a suitcase.

description: Akshay Kumar addresses the perception of being money-minded, stating he earns honestly and pays his taxes diligently. He recalls his younger days when he was fascinated by the idea of financial security through fixed deposits. Kumar emphasizes that earning money through hard work and contributing to society is his priority, dismissing criticism as long as he's not harming anyone.

Hyderabad cabbie assaults man over cancelled ride, forces victim to touch feet
description: In Hyderabad, a Rapido driver allegedly assaulted a passenger at AIG Hospital after a fare dispute. Balaji, the victim, cancelled the ride when the driver demanded extra money. The driver, along with associates, confronted Balaji, physically assaulted him, and filmed the incident.

Kelce & Reid: From fiery sideline clash to TV buzz; questions rise over Chiefs duo
description: Kansas City Chiefs faced New York Giants. The game saw a heated argument between coach Andy Reid and Travis Kelce. This happened during the second quarter. The Chiefs had managed only two field goals by halftime. Kelce had only two catches. The team has faced back-to-back losses. Pressure is mounting on the Chiefs to improve.

title: H-1B visa fee hike: Musk recalls his journey, says ‘I’m in America via H-1B’
description: Amidst a significant H-1B visa fee hike in the US, an old post from Elon Musk defending the program has resurfaced. Musk previously credited the H-1B visa for his own success and the growth of companies like SpaceX and Tesla.

title: Appointed, ignored & unpaid: Meet India's 'invisible' teachers
description: Across India, tens of thousands of teachers work without fair pay, job security, or recognition. Some have waited decades for a salary. Others left the profession broken. A recent Supreme Court verdict granted long-overdue parity to a group of Gujarat teachers — but for thousands more, justice remains out of reach.

title: Mumbai: Nigerian man killed by flatmates over dispute; attacked with glass bottle
description: A 32-year-old Nigerian man, Lucky Uijeh, was murdered in Nalasopara East on Saturday night, allegedly by his Nigerian friends following an old dispute. The Tulinj police have registered a murder case against the three accused, who resided in the same building as the deceased. Two suspects, Ayoola Barthlome and Oghene Igere, have been arrested, while Odia Peculiar remains at large.

title: MAGA mad about ‘TACO’, wants more stringent reading of H-1B order
H-1B visa hike: ‘Do not live in fear,’ says Zoho founder to Indians in US
description: Following a massive H-1B visa fee hike by the US, Zoho founder Sridhar Vembu advises Indian tech professionals in America to return to India and rebuild their careers. Drawing parallels with the Partition, he emphasizes India's growing opportunities and the potential for success, suggesting this reverse migration could strengthen India's tech ecosystem.
